page.title: 07THE BELL INN, TILE HILL
page.content: The Bell Inn is in Tile Hill Village. It is a public house attached to Bass brewery. It opens from 11a.m. until 2.30p.m. every lunchtime and reopens at 6p.m. On Mondays to Thursdays it closes at 10.30p.m. but at weekends it is open until 11p.m. The only day in the year it does not open is in the evening on Christmas Day. The busiest day of the week is Friday-both lunch- time and in the evening. Six and a half thousand pints of beer and lager are sold in one week while the most popular spirits are whisky and gin. A variety of fruit juices are sold as well as lemonade and coke. In the evening most of the customers are local but at lunchtime about 50% come from local factories as bar snacks are served then, the most popular being filled bread rolls, with hot snacks being sold more in cold weather.
